text: Assistant Shadow Treasurer Stephen Jones says Opposition Leader Anthony Albanese “is going to set the broad direction of what a Labor government will look like and the direction of policy development over the next three years,” in his speech on Tuesday. Mr Jones told Sky News Mr Albanese will be “focusing on jobs and the jobs we need to turn the economy around because we know that growth is flagging… expenses are going up, but wages aren’t”. The Assistant Shadow Treasurer said the opposition leader has “identified the importance of mining to a clean energy future,” and will talk about “the importance of Australia playing a key part in the renewable energy development”.
